title: Josh Quaas' Sports Data Site
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors



srs <- read_csv("PowerfiveSRS - Sheet1.csv")

Rows: 25 Columns: 3
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Conf
dbl (2): Year, SRS

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



ggplot() + geom_step(data=srs, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf, color=Conf)) 









SEC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "SEC")


BIG <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big Ten")


Bigtwelve <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big 12")


PAC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Pac-12")


ACC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "ACC")


 ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=SEC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="gold") + geom_line(data=BIG, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="skyblue") + geom_line(data=Bigtwelve, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="red") + geom_line(data=PAC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkblue") + geom_line(data=ACC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkgrey")+ 
  labs(
    x="Season", 
    y="Simple Rating System", 
    title="The Big Ten Has Only Been On Top Once", 
    subtitle="The SEC has controlled the top spot for most of the last five years. The Big Ten\nhas struggled to be the top Conference.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Josh Quaas"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )

title: How Has The Big Ten Compared To Other Power Five Schools In College Football Over The Last Five Full Seasons
text:
Write stuff


Code
library(tidyverse)

srs <- read_csv("PowerfiveSRS - Sheet1.csv")

SEC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "SEC")

BIG <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big Ten")

Bigtwelve <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big 12")

PAC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Pac-12")

ACC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "ACC")

 ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=SEC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="gold") + geom_line(data=BIG, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="skyblue") + geom_line(data=Bigtwelve, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="red") + geom_line(data=PAC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkblue") + geom_line(data=ACC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkgrey")+ 
  labs(
    x="Season", 
    y="Simple Rating System", 
    title="The Big Ten Has Only Been On Top Once", 
    subtitle="The SEC has controlled the top spot for most of the last five years. The Big Ten\nhas struggled to be the top Conference.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Josh Quaas"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )
